content: #hat_easy by @floralwool for personal use only this is a classic hat that can be easily altered to get a new design you will need - yarn approx 100-120gr i used pure merino 120m in 50 gr - needles 3 5mm of your preferred construction - knitting markers - tapestry needle check your gauge before knitting 32sts and 44rows in 10x10cm st s stitch es this is an algorithm how to make a hat so you can choose any yarn and any size to knit my hat is for the size 56-58cm cast on any number of sts multiple of 4 i casted on 136sts join to knit in the round *k1 p1* put the marker to mark the beginning of the round the hat is knitted in rib work approx 25 rounds for the brim to make the folded brim fixed there will be a fixed line so your brim will be in place work next 3 round the following way *slip 1 with yarn back 1p* - so you will slip all kstitches with yarn back and purl all p-sts you can watch my video how to make this line fixed brim video continue working *k1 p1* 15-18cm depending on the size i knitted 15cm for the size 56cm shaping the crown - divide your sts into 4 parts sections separate them using markers 136 4= 34sts each section - mark the last k-st in every section decreasing sts to shape the crown repeat in each section - sssk *p1 k1* till the last 6sts then k3tog p1 k1 p1 you will decrease 16sts i decreased sts in every third round and the last 2 i made in every second round to get a classic shape if you want to have slight elongated shape you can decrease sts in every 4th round how to make sssk and k3tog you can check here video repeat these rounds till you have 16sts left break off your yarn to leave a 25cm tail and thread through your remaining sts with a blunt yarn needle pull the yarn tail to draw your stitches together your hat is ready wash and block it carefully according to recommendations for your yarn
